topics.title: Mission-driven impact at the New York Times
topics.summary: Alex explains how NYT’s business goals (subscriptions, engagement) serve the broader mission of strengthening informed democracy, and how impact can also mean real-world policy change driven by reporting.

topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Alex and frames the conversation around how NYT builds product, including working with journalists and integrating acquisitions like Wordle.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Miro and Athletic Greens (AG1).

topics.title: Career path: NYT, Facebook, Atlantic, return
topics.summary: Alex walks through her career at the intersection of journalism and tech: a decade at NYT through mobile-first and paywall shifts, then Facebook, then The Atlantic, and back to NYT in 2019.

topics.title: Wartime product management after 2016 election
topics.summary: Alex describes joining Facebook’s news efforts post-2016 election, focusing on misinformation/disinformation, content classification, and shifting platform incentives toward trusted information.

topics.title: Thriving in chaos and high-stakes work
topics.summary: They discuss why some PMs are drawn to high-urgency environments, and the leadership skills required: prioritization, resilience, focus, and letting non-essentials slide.

topics.title: Returning to NYT and rejoining as leader
topics.summary: Alex shares what it was like to return to NYT on good terms, describing an interview process rooted in prior working relationships and growth as a leader.

topics.title: Defining NYT’s product and the subscription bundle
topics.summary: Alex explains how NYT’s product is journalism plus user experience, the shift from print to digital rebundling, and the expansion into multiple destinations (news, games, cooking, audio, etc.).

topics.title: Strategy: 15M subscribers and portfolio growth
topics.summary: Alex outlines the addressable market, the “news as the sun” portfolio metaphor, and the three strategic pillars: best news destination, strong category products, and a connected bundle.

topics.title: Org structure: functions, missions, and embedded editors
topics.summary: Alex describes how NYT organizes product/design via functional excellence plus cross-functional missions (consumer, monetization, platform), and how editors embed with consumer missions while preserving editorial independence.

topics.title: Building immersive storytelling and scalable formats
topics.summary: They explore how one-off newsroom experiments (interactive/visual/data journalism) inspire scalable storytelling platforms, balancing speed-of-news decisions with longer-term tooling and systems.

topics.title: Wordle acquisition and integration challenges
topics.summary: Alex recounts how Wordle was discovered and acquired quickly, why it fit NYT Games, and the technical/product work to migrate it (accounts, stats/streaks) while preserving the core experience—including the ‘fetus’ incident during Roe leak.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor read for Vanta (SOC 2 compliance automation).

topics.title: COVID response: rebuilding priorities and public service
topics.summary: Alex describes returning to NYT right before the pandemic and shifting into crisis mode: building COVID datasets and tools, making key coverage free, and rallying teams around mission-driven product work.
